result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kirk L.W. Preuss was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Defendant granted work release privileges, if he is employed.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway with any alcohol or restricted controlled substances in his blood.
Defendant shall only operate IID equipped vehicles.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.
Court authorizes a furlough when defendant has family wedding in June.  Defendant to make arrangements with jail.

Consecutive to: to 13CT160.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADA Isherwood present.
Def. present.
Atty. Ed Jelinski present.
Received copy of complaint.
Waive reading of complaint.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights to a PRELIM hearing, finds probable cause exists and binds matter over to ARGN to Branch III.
Information filed w/the Court.
Waive receipt & reading of information.
Ct. #1 - NC plea (OWI 4th)
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1.  Ct. #2 is dismissed.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
Probation - SW - 3 years - concurrent w/14 CF 69 probation.
Conditions:
1.  pay fine of $600.00 fine + costs + $32.50 blood draw = $1481.50
2.  def. to participate in AODA & DSP
3.  def. to not operate a MV on a hwy unless authorized by MVD.
4.  def. to not operate a MV on a hwy with any alcohol or restricted controlled substances in blood.
5.  def. only operate IID equipped vehicles.
6.  impose 6 month co jail w/WR privileges if he is employed - to be given good time credit - 6 months consecutive to 13 CT 160 (45 days) - def. to report immediately today - Court authorizes a furlough when def. has family wedding in June - def. to make arrangements with jail.
IID 36 months
d. l. revoked 36 months
Appeal rights explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
